intro: Crotalaria albida var. albida, commonly known as the white crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant produces cylindrical pods that contain several seeds, and it is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. It has a short stature, typically growing up to 30 cm in height, and is known for its rapid growth cycle.
